segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a growing puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman, standing in the water, seemingly oblivious to the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be lost in thought or perhaps just tired.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children, their eyes fixed on the cookie jar, unaware of the water creeping closer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of unease as I watch the boy balance precariously on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl, her hand outstretched, waiting for her share of the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they're quite the team, those two, always working together to get what they want.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the garden outside, a picture of calm compared to the kitchen's chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like a little oasis, just beyond the reach of the kitchen's madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman snaps out of her daze and the children get their cookies safely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what will happen next, if the stool will tip or the woman will finally notice the water.
segments.speaker: PAR
